labels.analysis: The Tesouro Direto MCP Server primarily focuses on providing natural language access to Brazilian treasury bond data from Tesouro Direto, a government bond program in Brazil. Its core functionality involves retrieving market data, detailed bond information, and searching/filtering bonds based on various criteria. The server supports querying and data retrieval in an MCP-compatible format, making it accessible through MCP clients. It also incorporates smart caching to optimize API usage while maintaining data freshness. The server solves problems related to accessing and filtering government bond data efficiently using natural language queries.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Financial Services" was chosen because the server mainly deals with financial data, specifically Brazilian treasury bonds, which falls under financial services. The secondary label "API Integration" was selected because the server integrates with external APIs (Tesouro Direto) to retrieve data. The secondary label "Data Analysis & Processing" was also deemed relevant due to the server's ability to process and filter bond data based on user queries. The custom label "Government Bond Data" was added to specifically describe the unique focus on Brazilian treasury bonds, which may not be covered by the predefined categories.

tools.name: market_data

tools.name: bond_data

tools.name: search_bonds
tools.description: Search for bonds by type (ANY,SELIC, IPCA, PREFIXADO) or maturity date range

maturityAfter.description: Filter bonds maturing after this date (YYYY-MM-DD)

maturityBefore.description: Filter bonds maturing before this date (YYYY-MM-DD)

server_info_crawled.overview: Enable natural language access to Brazilian treasury bond data through MCP-compatible clients. Query market data, bond details, and search/filter bonds using everyday language. Benefit from smart caching to reduce API calls while ensuring data freshness.

tools.name: market_data
tools.description: Retrieves general market data from Tesouro Direto, including opening/closing times and status

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

config = {
  "useMcpCache": true
}
# Encode config in base64
config_b64 = base64.b64encode(json.dumps(config).encode()).decode()
smithery_api_key = ""

# Create server URL
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@AtilioA/tesouro-direto-mcp/mcp?config={config_b64}&api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
